cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) NE of Cozumel, Mexico, near the Yucatan Channel
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move slowly north into the eastern Gulf of Mexico Monday, then turn northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend and the Southeast U.S. mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf of Mexico and Florida Big Bend through mid-week; southeast U.S. coast thereafter
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible as the cyclone passes well east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal rise (generally <2 ft) possible if onshore flow develops, but significant surge is not anticipated
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of showers with localized totals 1–3 inches possible Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls could temporarily reduce visibility and affect cargo handling, but prolonged operational disruption is not expected
